meanings.sent1: She used a pulley to elevate the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: The workers had to elevate the platform to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to elevate the rabbit, but it ended up in the wrong hat.
meanings.sent4: His kindness helped elevate the spirits of everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon helped elevate us above the treetops for a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: To promote to a higher rank or position
meanings.sent1: The company decided to elevate her to the position of manager.
meanings.sent2: His hard work and dedication finally led to his elevation to team leader.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to elevate itself to the status of king of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her new role as team captain will elevate her responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The promotion will elevate him to a more influential role within the organization.

meanings.definition: To increase the level or intensity of something
meanings.sent1: Adding more spices will elevate the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent2: The loud music helped elevate the excitement at the party.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's attempt to elevate the chaos only made things worse.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to elevate the mood of the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The stunning sunset colors served to elevate the beauty of the landscape.
